DOC.brief_title: A Study Ejaculatory Dysfunction Men With Low Testosterone Levels
DOC.criteria: Total testosterone level < 10.4 nanomoles per liter ( nmol/L ) [ 300 nanogram per deciliter ( ng/dL ) ] screen Presents 1 follow symptom ( ) ejaculatory dysfunction : delay ejaculation , anejaculation , decrease force ejaculation , decreased ejaculatory volume , determine investigator assessment ProstateSpecific Antigen ( PSA ) < 4 nanogram per milliliter ( ng/mL ) screen Sexual partner become pregnant time study Premature ejaculation determine investigator assessment Currently receive testosterone replacement therapy history insufficient response testosterone replacement therapy ejaculatory dysfunction symptom Currently receive treatment cancer chemotherapy antiandrogens History use estrogenizing agent Current use warfarin History selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( SSRI ) and/or serotoninnorepinephrine reuptake inhibitor ( SNRI ) treatment 6 month prior screen History frequent opioid use within 30 day prior screen , exception treatment chronic pain determine investigator . Body Mass Index ( BMI ) > 35 kilogram per square meter ( kg/m^2 ) screen Significant peripheral neuropathy affect erectile , ejaculatory , orgasmic function Hematocrit â‰¥50 % screen Exhibit systolic blood pressure > 170 millimeter mercury ( mm Hg ) < 90 mm Hg diastolic blood pressure > 100 mm Hg < 50 mm Hg screening ( stress suspect , retest basal condition screen ) , history malignant hypertension History follow coronary condition within 90 day screen : myocardial infarction , coronary artery bypass graft surgery , percutaneous coronary intervention ( example , angioplasty stent placement ) Known suspect carcinoma ( history carcinoma ) prostate suspicious nodule digital rectal exam screen Known suspect breast cancer ( history breast cancer ) active cancer ( exception nonmelanotic skin cancer )
